summary: The Facts First Act (H.R. 4938) introduced in the House of Representatives on August 8, 2025, aims to protect the Commissioner of Labor Statistics from arbitrary removal. It amends the Act of June 13, 1888, to stipulate that the Commissioner can only be removed based on proven inefficiency, neglect of duty, or malfeasance. This bill seeks to ensure the independence and objectivity of the agency responsible for publishing economic data.
